subsc: General industry and trade sector,General public administration sector
sectr: Industry and trade,Public Administration, Law, and Justice

abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Credit
            (SAC-IV) for Mali aims at: (i) contributing to broad-based
            growth and poverty reduction by strengthening fiscal policy
            and financial sector underpinnings of stable, long-run
            growth. Fiscal policy will be strengthened, inter alia, by
            developing medium-term expenditure policy consistent with
            poverty reduction objectives; strengthening the link between
            the Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (PRSP) and the budget;
            and limiting budget transfers to parastatal enterprises.
            Financial sector reform will be advanced by taking steps
            towards strengthening of the financial system, and limiting
            the risk of bank insolvency; (ii) improving efficiency,
            accountability, and transparency in public expenditure
            management. This will be achieved by strengthening budget
            preparation, execution, and controls, increasing
            transparency and disclosure including at decentralized
            levels, and helping ensure better monitoring of and access
            to basic services by the poor.
